result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Emmanuel T Hayes

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 10-25-2022

Defendant Emmanuel T Hayes appeared by video.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Emmanuel T Hayes.  Attorney James C Griffin in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a plea hearing.  Defense informs the court that Mr. Hayes has tested positive for COVID and requests an adjournment.  Court ordered COVID documentation to be provided at the next court date.  Parties inform the court of new charges.  Court scheduled a status conference and informs Mr. Hayes that an IN PERSON appearance is REQUIRED.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-18-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 10-17-2022
Justice Point Violation (Missed Office Contact) Report

Defendant Emmanuel T Hayes in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Emmanuel T Hayes.  Prosecuting attorney James C Griffin in court for the State of Wisconsin. HEARING HELD OFF THE RECORD. Scheduling conference held. Defense is requesting a plea hearing. Court will accept all defendants matters for resolution. Case is adjourned in Branch 02.
Plea hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Defense appeared in court to request move of case from 9-12-2022 to 9-14-2022 1:30 pm. Court grants. Parties notified.

Defendant Emmanuel T Hayes in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Emmanuel T Hayes appeared by video means with Attorney.    
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Emmanuel T Hayes in court with attorney Ruby De Leon.  Defendant Emmanuel T Hayes in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Emmanuel T Hayes appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 1 and 4.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
